page.title: 01The Smaller Ascrib Islands
page.content: The smaller Ascribs are a scatter of reefs and skerries to the north-west of the main island South Ascrib. Their Gaelic names give some idea of their characteristics - Eilean Iosal, the low mean island. Eilean Creagach, the rocky island, Sgeir a Chuain, Ocean reef, Eilean Garbh, rough stormy island, Sgeir a Chapuill, Horse skerry maybe, perhaps because of its shape. They are lichen-covered outcrops of basalt, homes for seals and roosting- places for seabirds, cormorants, seagulls, eiderduck, inhospitable and uninhabitable. Recently the Ascribs were bought by a man from England who tried to gain planning consent for a house on South Ascrib. This was refused.
